wikipedia_page.main: Richard Wood (13 March 1839 – 1 January 1923) was an Australian politician. He was the member for North Adelaide in the South Australian House of Assembly from 1893 to 1902. He was a Labor member from 1893 until he was expelled in 1897. He was re-elected in his own right in 1899, but was defeated in 1902.He contested the single statewide seven-member Division of South Australia at the 1901 federal election as a Free Trade Party candidate.
